intro: Noccaea epirota, commonly known as the Epirus nephrolepis, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in calcareous soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in the region.
